Activity: Log in, check emails, and review project tasks for the week. Make a prioritized to-do list based on the overall goal. Start with the highest priority module that needs to be completed and tested.
Dive into the code for the highest priority software module. Focus on finishing any incomplete functions and writing unit tests to ensure each part works as expected. (Module A).
Run unit tests for Module A. Debug any failing tests. If the logic is complicated, take a break and then return to it with a fresh pair of eyes.
Document the completed functionalities of Module A, focusing on clear explanations and examples. Write a description for the function and parameters of each method.
Lunch Break. Catch up with colleagues in the break room.
Continue working on Module A - integration tests. Confirm the integration between different parts of the module is successful. If not, debug the issue and make necessary modifications.
After the integration test is cleared, ask @larch-1 (Lead Software Architect) for a code review of Module A, and incorporate feedback into the code.
Prepare a summary of the work completed on Module A, including functionalities delivered, tests passed, and documentation updated. Send an email to @pm-1 (Project Manager) about the progress.
Plan for tomorrow. Preview the next module to be developed and identify any potential challenges.
